courses: Research interests: Machine Learning and Optimization, including deep learning, meta learning, Bayesian optimization, reinforcement learning, evolutionary computation, statistical learning, time series analysis, stochastic processes, and their applications in real-world problems.
PhD thesis: Surrogate-Assisted Evolutionary Algorithms for Computationally Expensive Optimization Problems.
Primary supervisor: Prof. Xin Yao (relocated to a position outside the UK in 2017).
Secondary supervisor: Prof. Joshua Knowles (left UoB due to illness in 2017).
Completed PhD on my own after both supervisors departed UoB, demonstrating ability to conduct independent research.

Selected courses: Calculus, linear algebra, probability & statistics, programming, data structures, operating systems, algorithm, database, data mining, pattern recognition, mathematical modeling, digital image processing, computer network.

Work Experience.name: Department of Economics, University of Warwick
highlights: Line managers: Dr. Amrita Kulka (assistant professor) and Dr. Nikhil Datta (assistant professor).
Scraping high-dimensional, complex data from 425 idiosyncratic online planning platforms via deploying scrapers on AWS.
Built and deployed 200+ production scrapers across 10+ frameworks, extracting data and documents from over 12M planning applications.
Using OCR machine learning and computer vision approaches to analyse texts in PDFs.

Work Experience.name: Ford Motor Company
highlights: Line manager: Dr. Yan Wang (technical expert).
Processed and analyzed large real-world motor engine datasets to uncover intrinsic patterns from the data.
Applied machine learning (e.g. deep learning, meta-learning) and statistical learning (e.g. Gaussian Processes) techniques to develop predictive models for motor engines.
Developed intelligent model-based optimization / Bayesian optimization algorithms to calibrate gasoline motor engines.
Achieved a 40% improvement in calibration efficiency and an 80% increase in the number of feasible engine designs.
Worked on multi-disciplinary teams with diverse backgrounds.

Work Experience.name: Learning And Mining from DatA (LAMDA) Group, Nanjing University
highlights: Research topics: Machine Learning, Statistical Learning, Bayesian Optimization.
Developed a co-training semi-supervised regression approach for predictive modeling.
Designed a top-querying strategy integrating these models with CMA optimization, improving optimization efficiency by up to 64% across Bayesian optimization problems.

Projects[None].name: Quantum Computing
Projects[None].summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.

Publications.name: FSEO: Few-Shot Evolutionary Optimization via Meta-Learning for Expensive Multi-Objective Optimization
Publications.publisher: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems 39 (NeurIPS'25)

Publications.name: Engine Calibration With Surrogate-Assisted Bilevel Evolutionary Algorithm
Internal Combustion Engine Calibration Using Optimization Algorithms
Domination-Based Ordinal Regression for Expensive Multi-Objective Optimization
Publications.publisher: Proceedings of the 2019 IEEE Symposium Series on Computational Intelligence (SSCI'19)

Academic Services.organization: IEEE {TEVC, TCYB, TETCI}, Applied Energy, Evolving Systems, etc.

Honors and Awards.title: CAGE Research Grant
Honors and Awards.awarder: The ESRC Centre for Advantage in the Global Economy (CAGE), University of Warwick

Honors and Awards.title: Outstanding Student, Department of Computer Science & Technology
